Term.Name: Movies and Games
Term.Definition: Movies and Games ratings as defined by the Australian Office of Film and Literature Classification (http://www.oflc.gov.au)

Term.Name: E
Term.Definition: Exempt From Classification

Term.Name: P
Term.Definition: Suitable for All Ages

Term.Name: PG
Term.Definition: Parental Guidance is Recommended for Young Viewers

Term.Name: M
Term.Definition: Suitable for Mature Audiences

Term.Name: MA15+
Term.Definition: Suitable for Mature Audiences Only

Term.Name: R18+
Term.Definition: Restricted to Adults 18 Years and Over

Term.Name: X18+
Term.Definition: Restricted to Adults 18 Years and Over (ACT and NT Only) - Very Strong and Graphic Sex Scenes

Term.Name: RC
Term.Definition: Refused Classification

Term.Name: TV Programs
Term.Definition: Movies and Games ratings as defined by the Australian Office of Film and Literature Classification (http://www.oflc.gov.au)

Term.Name: P
Term.Definition: Programmes suited specifically for pre-school children

Term.Name: C
Term.Definition: Programmes suited for children 5 to 11 years of age

Term.Name: G
Term.Definition: General Exhibition - Programmes which are suitable for all ages, but are not specifically geared towards children

Term.Name: PG
Term.Definition: Parental Guidance - Parental Guidance is recommended for young children. - Cannot be Shown between 4:00pm and 7:00pm on weekdays.

Term.Name: M
Term.Definition: Mature - Recommended for Mature Audiences. - Can only be shown between 12:00pm - 3:00pm on School Days and 8:30pm - 5:00am any day

Term.Name: MA15+
Term.Definition: Mature Audience Only - Not suitable for Persons Under the Age of 15. - Can only be shown between 9:00pm - 5:00am. A parental warning must be shown before the program starts

Term.Name: AV15+
Term.Definition: Adult Violence - Not Suitable for Persons Under the Age of 15 - The AV 15+ signifies that the program contains significant violence

Term.Name: KT
Term.Definition: Suitable for all

Term.Name: KNT
Term.Definition: Unsuitable for children

Term.Name: Movies and Games
Term.Definition: Movies and Games ratings as defined by the DJCTQ (http://www.mj.gov.br/classificacao)

Term.Name: General
Term.Definition: This rating means that the film/game can be watched/played by anyone and doesn't have any inappropriate content

Term.Name: 12 years
Term.Definition: This film/game is recommended for persons with or over 12 years of age. May contain a little inappropriate language, sexual innuendo, or mild violence.

Term.Name: 14 years
Term.Definition: This film/game is recommended for persons with or over 14 years of age. May contain inappropriate language, sexual innuendo and/or mild sex with no nudity or the act being explicit shown, violence, mention to drug use.

Term.Name: 16 years
Term.Definition: This film/game is recommended for persons with or over 16 years of age. May contain strong language, sexual innuendo and/or mild sex with or without mild nudity, strong violence, drug use.

Term.Name: 18 years
Term.Definition: This film/game is forbidden for people under 18 years of age. It may contain strong language, intense sex, strong nudity, strong violence, intense drug use. It is also used to rate pornographic films..

Term.Name: The Council of Cinematographic Classification
Term.Definition: Movie ratings as defined by the Consejo de Calificación Cinematográfica (http://w3app.mineduc.cl/Consejo/index)

Term.Name: TE
Term.Definition: All Audiences
Inappropriate for children under 14
Suitable for people aged 18 and over

Term.Name: 18/S
Term.Definition: Suitable for people aged 18 and over with sexually explicit content

Term.Name: 18/V
Term.Definition: Suitable for people aged 18 and over with extreme violence content

Term.Name: The Ministry of Culture, Colombia
Term.Definition: Movie ratings as defined by the Colombian Ministry of Culture (http://www.mincultura.gov.co)

Term.Name: T
Term.Definition: All Audiences
Suitable for people aged 7 and over
Suitable for people aged 12 and over
Suitable for people aged 14 and over
Suitable for people aged 18 and over

Term.Name: X
Term.Definition: Pornographic Content

Term.Name: The Media Council for Children and Young People
Term.Definition: Scheme as defined by the Danish Media Council for Children and Young People (http://www.medieraadet.dk/html/gb/gb.htm)

Term.Name: A
Term.Definition: Approval of the film for general admittance
Approval of the film for general admittance, but not recommended for children under the age of 7
Approval of the film for admittance of children from the age of 11
Approval of the film for admittance of children from the age of 15

Term.Name: Movies and Some Games
Term.Definition: Scheme as defined by Finnish Board of Film Classification (http://www.vet.fi/english/board.html)

Term.Name: S
Term.Definition: For all ages

Term.Name: K-7
Term.Definition: For people aged 7 years and above

Term.Name: K-11
Term.Definition: For people aged 11 years and above

Term.Name: K-13
Term.Definition: For people aged 13 years and above

Term.Name: K-15
Term.Definition: For people aged 15 years and above

Term.Name: K-18
Term.Definition: For people aged 18 years and above

Term.Name: U
Term.Definition: For all audiences
Unsuitable for minors under 10 or forbidden in cinemas for under 10s
Unsuitable for minors under 12 or forbidden in cinemas for under 12s
Unsuitable for minors under 16 or forbidden in cinemas for under 16s
Unsuitable for minors under 18 or forbidden in cinemas for under 18s

Term.Name: Voluntary Self-Control of the Film Business, FSK
Term.Definition: Scheme as defined by the Freiwillige Selbstkontrolle der Filmwirtschaft (http://www.spio.de)

Term.Name: FSK 0
Term.Definition: For all ages

Term.Name: FSK 6
Term.Definition: No one under 6 years admitted

Term.Name: FSK 12
Term.Definition: People 12 or older admitted, children between 6 and 11 only when accompanied by parent or legal guardian

Term.Name: FSK 16
Term.Definition: People 16 or older admitted

Term.Name: FSK 18
Term.Definition: Only adults (18 or older) admitted. Replaced by Keine Jugendfreigabe

Term.Name: Keine Jugendfreigabe
Term.Definition: "No youth admitted", only adults

Term.Name: SPIO/JK
Term.Definition: Checked for possible violation against applicable law. Not rated by the FSK. It's legal to sell such a title to a person which is 18 or older

Term.Name: Irish Film Censor's Office (Movies)
Term.Definition: Scheme as defined by the Irish Film Censor"s Office (http://www.ifco.ie)

Term.Name: G
Term.Definition: 'General' - Suitable for viewing by anyone

Term.Name: PG
Term.Definition: 'Parental Guidance' - Parental guidance is recommended for children under the age of 12

Term.Name: 12A
Term.Definition: Parent supervision required for children under 12

Term.Name: 15A
Term.Definition: Parent supervision required for children under 15
Films classified in this category are considered to be suitable for persons of 16 or over
Adults only

Term.Name: T
Term.Definition: All admitted

Term.Name: VM14
Term.Definition: No one under the age of 14 admitted

Term.Name: VM18
Term.Definition: No one under the age of 18 admitted

Term.Name: Kijkwijzer
Term.Definition: Scheme as defined by the Kijkwijzer system (http://www.Kijkwijzer.nl)

Term.Name: AL
Term.Definition: Suitable for all ages
Not recommended for viewers younger than 6 years
Not recommended for viewers younger than 9 years
Not recommended for viewers younger than 12 years
Movie shops/cinemas aren't allowed to show these movies to people younger than 16 years

Term.Name: The Norwegian Media Authority
Term.Definition: Scheme as defined by the Medietilsynet (http://www.medietilsynet.no)

Term.Name: Ministre of Culture
Term.Definition: Scheme as defined by the Comissão de Classificação de Espectáculos (http://www.cce.org.pt)

Term.Name: M/4
Term.Definition: For persons of age 4 and above

Term.Name: M/6
Term.Definition: For persons of age 6 and above

Term.Name: M/12
Term.Definition: For persons of age 12 and above

Term.Name: M/16
Term.Definition: For persons of age 16 and above

Term.Name: M/18
Term.Definition: For persons of age 18 and above

Term.Name: Korea Media Rating Board
Term.Definition: Scheme as defined by the Korea Media Rating Board (http://www.kmrb.or.kr/english/statistics_i.asp)

Term.Name: All
Term.Definition: Suitable for all ages
Suitable for those aged 12 and over
Suitable for those aged 15 and over
Suitable for those aged 18 and over

Term.Name: TP
Term.Definition: Suitable for the general public
Not recommended for people under 7
Not recommended for people under 10
Not recommended for people under 13
Not recommended for people under 16
Not recommended for people under 18

Term.Name: X
Term.Definition: Strictly for adults

Term.Name: Swedish National Board of Film Censors
Term.Definition: Scheme as defined by Statens biografbyrå (http://www.statensbiografbyra.se)

Term.Name: Btl
Term.Definition: Suitable for all ages
Suitable for children of at least 7 years of age
Suitable for children of at least 11 years of age
No one under 15 years of age admitted
No one under 18 years of age admitted

Term.Name: British Board of Film Classification
Term.Definition: Scheme as defined by the British Board of Film Classification (http://www.bbfc.co.uk)

Term.Name: Uc
Term.Definition: Suitable for all but especially for young children

Term.Name: U
Term.Definition: Suitable for all

Term.Name: PG
Term.Definition: All ages admitted, but Parental Guidance is recommended

Term.Name: 12A/12
Term.Definition: No one under 12 years of age may see a "12A" film (unless accompanied by an adult) in a cinema or rent or buy a "12" video
No one under 15 years of age may see a "15" film or rent or buy a "15" video
Suitable only for adults

Term.Name: R18
Term.Definition: To be supplied only in licensed sex shops or cinemas to adults of not less than 18 years of age

Term.Name: Motion Picture Association of America
Term.Definition: Scheme for motion picture rating as defined by the Motion Picture Association of America (http://www.mpaa.org/FilmRatings.asp)

Term.Name: G
Term.Definition: General Audience - All ages admitted

Term.Name: PG
Term.Definition: Parental guidance suggested - Some material may not be suitable for young children

Term.Name: PG-13
Term.Definition: Parents strongly cautioned - Some material may be inappropriate for children under 13

Term.Name: R
Term.Definition: Restricted - Under 17 requires accompanying parent or adult guardian

Term.Name: NC-17
Term.Definition: No one 17 and under admitted

Term.Name: NR
Term.Definition: Not an MPAA rating

Term.Name: Entertainment Software Rating Board
Term.Definition: Scheme for game rating as defined by the Entertainment Software Rating Board (http://www.esrb.org/ratings/ratings_guide.jsp)

Term.Name: ESRB Rating Symbols
Term.Definition: Rating symbols suggest age appropriateness for the game

Term.Name: EC
Term.Definition: Titles rated EC (Early Childhood) have content that may be suitable for ages 3 and older. Contains no material that parents would find inappropriate

Term.Name: E
Term.Definition: Titles rated E (Everyone) have content that may be suitable for ages 6 and older. Titles in this category may contain minimal cartoon, fantasy or mild violence and/or infrequent use of mild language

Term.Name: E10+
Term.Definition: Titles rated E10+ (Everyone 10 and older) have content that may be suitable for ages 10 and older. Titles in this category may contain more cartoon, fantasy or mild violence, mild language and/or minimal suggestive themes

Term.Name: T
Term.Definition: Titles rated T (Teen) have content that may be suitable for ages 13 and older. Titles in this category may contain violence, suggestive themes, crude humour, minimal blood, simulated gambling, and/or infrequent use of strong language

Term.Name: M
Term.Definition: Titles rated M (Mature) have content that may be suitable for persons ages 17 and older. Titles in this category may contain intense violence, blood and gore, sexual content and/or strong language

Term.Name: AO
Term.Definition: Titles rated AO (Adults Only) have content that should only be played by persons 18 years and older. Titles in this category may include prolonged scenes of intense violence and/or graphic sexual content and nudity

Term.Name: RP
Term.Definition: Titles listed as RP (Rating Pending) have been submitted to the ESRB and are awaiting final rating. (This symbol appears only in advertising prior to a game's release)

Term.Name: ESRB Content Descriptors
Term.Definition: Content descriptors indicate elements in a game that may have triggered a particular rating and/or may be of interest or concern

Term.Name: Alcohol Reference
Term.Definition: Reference to and/or images of alcoholic beverages

Term.Name: Animated Blood
Term.Definition: Discoloured and/or unrealistic depictions of blood

Term.Name: Blood
Term.Definition: Depictions of blood

Term.Name: Blood and Gore
Term.Definition: Depictions of blood or the mutilation of body parts

Term.Name: Cartoon Violence
Term.Definition: Violent actions involving cartoon-like situations and characters. May include violence where a character is unharmed after the action has been inflicted

Term.Name: Comic Mischief
Term.Definition: Depictions or dialogue involving slapstick or suggestive humour

Term.Name: Crude Humour
Term.Definition: Depictions or dialogue involving vulgar antics, including 'bathroom" humour

Term.Name: Drug Reference
Term.Definition: Reference to and/or images of illegal drugs

Term.Name: Edutainment
Term.Definition: Content of product provides user with specific skills development or reinforcement learning within an entertainment setting. Skill development is an integral part of product

Term.Name: Fantasy Violence
Term.Definition: Violent actions of a fantasy nature, involving human or non-human characters in situations easily distinguishable from real life

Term.Name: Informational
Term.Definition: Overall content of product contains data, facts, resource information, reference materials or instructional text

Term.Name: Intense Violence
Term.Definition: Graphic and realistic-looking depictions of physical conflict. May involve extreme and/or realistic blood, gore, weapons and depictions of human injury and death

Term.Name: Language
Term.Definition: Mild to moderate use of profanity

Term.Name: Lyrics
Term.Definition: Mild references to profanity, sexuality, violence, alcohol or drug use in music

Term.Name: Mature Humour
Term.Definition: Depictions or dialogue involving "adult" humour, including sexual references

Term.Name: Mild Violence
Term.Definition: Mild scenes depicting characters in unsafe and/or violent situations

Term.Name: Nudity
Term.Definition: Graphic or prolonged depictions of nudity

Term.Name: Partial Nudity
Term.Definition: Brief and/or mild depictions of nudity

Term.Name: Real Gambling
Term.Definition: Player can gamble, including betting or wagering real cash or currency

Term.Name: Sexual Themes
Term.Definition: Mild to moderate sexual references and/or depictions. May include partial nudity

Term.Name: Sexual Violence
Term.Definition: Depictions of rape or other violent sexual acts

Term.Name: Simulated Gambling
Term.Definition: Player can gamble without betting or wagering real cash or currency

Term.Name: Some Adult Assistance May Be Needed
Term.Definition: Intended for very young ages

Term.Name: Strong Language
Term.Definition: Explicit and/or frequent use of profanity

Term.Name: Strong Lyrics
Term.Definition: Explicit and/or frequent references to profanity, sex, violence, alcohol or drug use in music

Term.Name: Strong Sexual Content
Term.Definition: Graphic references to and/or depictions of sexual behaviour, possibly including nudity

Term.Name: Suggestive Themes
Term.Definition: Mild provocative references or materials

Term.Name: Tobacco Reference
Term.Definition: Reference to and/or images of tobacco products

Term.Name: Use of Drugs
Term.Definition: The consumption or use of illegal drugs

Term.Name: Use of Alcohol
Term.Definition: The consumption of alcoholic beverages

Term.Name: Use of Tobacco
Term.Definition: The consumption of tobacco products

Term.Name: Violence
Term.Definition: Scenes involving aggressive conflict

Term.Name: Recording Industry Association of America
Term.Definition: Scheme for music rating as defined by the Recording Industry Association of America (http://www.riaa.com/issues/parents/advisory.asp)

Term.Name: Parental Advisory
Term.Definition: The Parental Advisory is a notice to consumers that recordings identified by this value may contain strong language or depiction of violence, sex or substance abuse. Parental discretion is advised

Term.Name: Pan European Game Information
Term.Definition: Scheme as defined by the Pan European Game Information (http://www.pegi.info)
Recommended for age 3 or over
Recommended for age 7 or over
Recommended for age 12 or over
Recommended for age 16 or over
Recommended for age 18 or over
